title: Man Utd-linked Aleksandr Sobolev reveals Arsenal scouting trip
text:
Aleksandr Sobolev is being linked with both Manchester United and Arsenal (Picture: Getty)

Russian forward Aleksandr Sobolev has claimed that Arsenal sent scouts to watch him play for Kryliya Sovetov in their 2-0 victory over Sochi at the weekend.

Sobolev, 22, regarded as one of the most promising strikers in the Russian Premier League, scored both goals at the Fisht Olympic Stadium to take his tally to ten for the campaign.

Recent reports have credited Manchester United with a strong interest in the youngster who was recently rewarded with his first senior call-up to the Russian national side.

Though Sobolev has played down speculation linking him with a move to Old Trafford, he admits it’s his ‘dream’ to compete in the Premier League.

Sobolev received his first international call-up this month (Picture: Getty)

‘Manchester United’s interest? I can’t even imagine how this could be,’ he told Sport Express.

‘Where am I, and where are United?

‘It is my dream to play in England but in order to do so I have to keep on scoring goals, training and working hard.’

Sovetov received information that Arsenal had sent scouts to watch him scoring a double at Sochi on Saturday.

‘I was told after the Sochi game that Arsenal scouts came to see me,’ he added.

‘In my opinion this is true. I am not 100 per cent sure, but this is what I was told.

‘They said that the scouts were sitting in the stand.’
